page.description: Returns a pointer to the specified child object contained by the object.

argument.name: num
argument.description: The number of the child object.

argument.name: name
argument.description: The name of the child object.

item.name: Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for <OBJECT> use either the <FORM> pointer or the name of the form)
Form Controls (for <OBJECT> use the <CONTROL> pointer or the address of the control)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.CHILD() method returns a pointer to the specified child object.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example illustrates the retrieval of several properties of a button on a form.
section.example: dim ptr as P dim cptr as P ptr = form.load("Customer Information") cptr = ptr.child("Button1") ? cptr.text = "Mail Merge" ? cptr.object.width = 0.900000 ? cptr.object.height = 0.350000
